definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all

sentences.english: It is an alternative for the investors to develop residential areas in the metropolitan fringe.
sentences.chinese: 大都市邊緣區住宅開發是大多數開發商的可能選擇。

sentences.english: He was dazzled by the gaiety and splendour of the metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 大都市的花花世界使他感到眼花繚亂。

sentences.english: But the desert is encroaching on this metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 但是，沙漠正侵蝕着這個大都市。

sentences.english: William. Nature's Metropolis: Chicago and the Great West. W. W. Norton & Company, 1991.
sentences.chinese: 一部關於芝加哥如何成爲西部大都市的重要研究。

sentences.english: Gratuity is customary in this money-mad  metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在這個金錢至上的大都市裏，給小費是司空見慣的。

sentences.english: Today, Beijing has already developed into a modern international metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 今日的北京，更已發展成爲一座現代化的國際大都市。

sentences.english: London is one of the greenest capitals in the world.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦是世界上最環保的大都市之一。

sentences.english: The newcomer is not used to the heavy traffic in big cities.
sentences.chinese: 新來者對大都市擁擠的交通很不習慣。

sentences.english: Dunhuang in China, deep in the heart of the Gebi Desert, was once a great city.
sentences.chinese: 中國的敦煌，地處戈壁沙漠的腹地，曾經是個大都市。

sentences.english: Today's Shanghai has become a world -famous international metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 今日之上海，已經成爲享譽中外的國際大都市。

sentences.english: Chongqing, a metropolis in the southwest of China, has set up an Anti-Cult Federation of Chongqing.
sentences.chinese: 中國西南的大都市重慶成立了重慶市反邪教聯合會。

sentences.english: The pics above are Metroplex's normal robot mode.
sentences.chinese: 上圖是大都市的常規機器人形態。

sentences.english: Beijing is an international city and deserves the great honor that was bestowed on it.
sentences.chinese: 北京是一座國際大都市，不愧其天賜的偉大榮耀。

sentences.english: Shanghai is an international city with excellent transport links. It has airline routes to 59 cities in the world, 14 international sea routes.
sentences.chinese: 上海作爲一個國際化的大都市，交通十分發達。

sentences.english: By the mid-21st century, the city will become a first-class modern international metropolis in the world.
sentences.chinese: 21世紀中葉，上海將世界一流的現代國際化大都市。

sentences.english: But these new megacities are havens for religious revivals.
sentences.chinese: 但這些大都市卻是宗教復興的避風港。

definition: Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou/abbr. for 北京、上海、廣州|北京、上海、广州
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Shenzhen/abbr. for 北京、上海、廣州、深圳|北京、上海、广州、深圳
